author: Staff Reporter
text:
A one-year-old bull died of suspected poisoning at West Soorangudy village, 8 km away from here on Sunday.

C. Shoba, secretary of Kanyakumari chapter of Peoples for Animals, an organisation headed by Maneka Gandhi, Union Minister for Women and Child Development, alleged that unidentified persons had laced pesticide in banana and fed the animal when it had gone for gracing in the village. The bull fainted and died instantly after reaching home.

Ms. Shoba and executive committee member S.S. Davidson had alerted the police and veterinary officials on hearing about the death of the animal. They wanted the Rajakkamangalam police to register a first information report. The bull was cremated after post-mortem conducted by officials from Animal Husbandry department. Police have seized some banana laced with pesticide from the place, where the bull had gone for gracing, Ms. Shoba said.
title: Poisoning of young bull alleged
